page.title: 10HEYBROOK BAY 1
page.content: {Mrs B.Wanstall}a resident since 1960 was interviewed and said that{Heybrook {Drive}in 1960 was a track and cars wo- uld not go down.There were about 40 houses in the bay in 1960,and the land on which the{Longlands Estate}was later built was just a field in which she used to go mushroom picking.They had{filled the ruts}as best they could,as the{Council}refused to make up the road,but they promised to adopt it if residents would get it repaired, every house was canvassed,and most people agreed to pay for their own frontage at Â£1 per foot.Before the road was{adopted by the Council the sewage system led out into the bay. Most wanted to go on mains{drainage,so the new road was dug up yet again for {the sewer.}The Guest House at the bottom of{Heybrook Bay}is the only hotel in the bay now.
